question:
Consider the following 4 electrodes:
<katex>$A:Ag^{+}(0.0001M)/Ag_{(s)}$</katex>
<katex>$B:Ag^{+}(0.1M)/Ag_{(s)}$</katex>
<katex>$C:Ag^{+}(0.01M)/Ag_{(s)}$</katex>
<katex>$D:Ag^{+}(0.001M)/Ag_{(s)}$</katex>
Then reduction potential in volts of the electrodes in the order
explanation: According to Nernst Equation for <katex>$Ag^+ + e^- \rightarrow Ag$</katex>:
The reduction potential <katex>$E$</katex> is directly proportional to <katex>$\log [Ag^+]$</katex>.
Higher concentration <katex>$[Ag^+]$</katex> means higher reduction potential.
Order of Potential: B > C > D > A.
